intro: Globulea latibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract globule, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow flower heads that are surrounded by broad, leaf-like bracts. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Globulea latibracteata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
